headline: Tell HN: A way coders could help Ukraine
description:
Ukraine is posting photos and videos of captured or killed Russian soldiers, for their families to find. But who wants to scroll through that? And might the resulting psychological harm[1] not damage Ukraine's support?

More effective, I think, would be a site that lets a relative upload some photos and matches them via facial recognition to data on her son, if available.

This could also help Ukraine fend off later accusations of violating the Geneva Convention, which says governments must protect POWs from “insults and public curiosity." https://www.washingtonpost.com/technology/2022/03/03/telegram-russian-war-dead-ukraine-pows/

[1] https://www.theverge.com/2020/5/12/21255870/facebook-content-moderator-settlement-scola-ptsd-mental-health
headline_zh-Hans: 告诉HN：编码员可以帮助乌克兰的一种方式
headline_zh-Hant: 告訴HN：編碼員可以幫助烏克蘭的一種方式
description_zh-Hans:
乌克兰正在张贴被俘或被杀的俄罗斯士兵的照片和视频，供其家人查找。但是，谁愿意翻阅这些东西呢？而且，由此产生的心理伤害[1]可能不会损害乌克兰的支持？

我认为，更有效的做法是建立一个网站，让亲属上传一些照片，并通过面部识别与她儿子的数据相匹配（如果有的话）。

这也可以帮助乌克兰抵御以后对违反日内瓦公约的指控，该公约规定政府必须保护战俘免受 "侮辱和公众好奇心的影响。" https://www.washingtonpost.com/technology/2022/03/03/telegram-russian-war-dead-ukraine-pows/

<1] https://www.theverge.com/2020/5/12/21255870/facebook-content-moderator-settlement-scola-ptsd-mental-health
